text: dian cleft lip - Microcephaly - Microretrognathia - Milia - Ovarian cyst - Polycystic kidney dysplasia - Polydactyly - Porencephaly - Radial deviation of finger - Short stature - Sparse hair - Syndactyly - Tongue nodules - X-linked dominant inheritance - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually list
